query: Q1. You are part of data science team that is working for a national fast-food chain. You create a simple report that shows trend: Customers who visit the store more often and buy smaller meals spend more than customers who visit less frequently and buy larger meals. What is the most likely diagram that your team created?
options:
multiclass classification diagram
 linear regression and scatter plots
 pivot table
 K-means cluster diagram

query: Q2. You work for an organization that sells a spam filtering service to large companies. Your organization wants to transition its product to use machine learning. It currently a list Of 250,00 keywords. If a message contains more than few of these keywords, then it is identified as spam. What would be one advantage of transitioning to machine learning?
options:
The product would look for new patterns in spam messages.
 The product could go through the keyword list much more quickly.
 The product could have a much longer keyword list.
 The product could find spam messages using far fewer keywords.

query: Q3. You work for a music streaming service and want to use supervised machine learning to classify music into different genres. Your service has collected thousands of songs in each genre, and you used this as your training data. Now you pull out a small random subset of all the songs in your service. What is this subset called?
options:
data cluster
 Supervised set
 big data
 test data

query: Q4. In traditional computer programming, you input commands. What do you input with machine learning?
options:
patterns
 programs
 rules
 data

query: Q5. Your company wants to predict whether existing automotive insurance customers are more likely to buy homeowners insurance. It created a model to better predict the best customers contact about homeowners insurance, and the model had a low variance but high bias. What does that say about the data model?
options:
It was consistently wrong.
 It was inconsistently wrong.
 It was consistently right.
 It was equally right end wrong.

query: Q6. You want to identify global weather patterns that may have been affected by climate change. To do so, you want to use machine learning algorithms to find patterns that would otherwise be imperceptible to a human meteorologist. What is the place to start?
options:
Find labeled data of sunny days so that the machine will learn to identify bad weather.
 Use unsupervised learning have the machine look for anomalies in a massive weather database.
 Create a training set of unusual patterns and ask the machine learning algorithms to classify them.
 Create a training set of normal weather and have the machine look for similar patterns.

query: Q7. You work in a data science team that wants to improve the accuracy of its K-nearest neighbor result by running on top of a naive Bayes result. What is this an example of?
options:
regression
 boosting
 bagging
 stacking

query: Q8. `____` looks at the relationship between predictors and your outcome.
options:
Regression analysis
 K-means clustering
 Big data
 Unsupervised learning

query: Q9. What is an example of a commercial application for a machine learning system?
options:
a data entry system
 a data warehouse system
 a massive data repository
 a product recommendation system

query: Q11. You work for a power company that owns hundreds of thousands of electric meters. These meters are connected to the internet and transmit energy usage data in real-time. Your supervisor asks you to direct project to use machine learning to analyze this usage data. Why are machine learning algorithms ideal in this scenario?
options:
The algorithms would help the meters access the internet.
 The algorithms will improve the wireless connectivity.
 The algorithms would help your organization see patterns of the data.
 By using machine learning algorithms, you are creating an IoT device.

query: Q12. To predict a quantity value. use `___`.
options:
regression
 clustering
 classification
 dimensionality reduction

query: Q13. Why is naive Bayes called naive?
options:
It naively assumes that you will have no data.
 It does not even try to create accurate predictions.
 It naively assumes that the predictors are independent from one another.
 It naively assumes that all the predictors depend on one another.

query: Q15. How is machine learning related to artificial intelligence?
options:
Artificial intelligence focuses on classification, while machine learning is about clustering data.
 Machine learning is a type of artificial intelligence that relies on learning through data.
 Artificial intelligence is form of unsupervised machine learning.
 Machine learning and artificial intelligence are the same thing.

query: Q16. How do machine learning algorithms make more precise predictions?
options:
The algorithms are typically run more powerful servers.
 The algorithms are better at seeing patterns in the data.
 Machine learning servers can host larger databases.
 The algorithms can run on unstructured data.

query: Q17. You work for an insurance company. Which machine learning project would add the most value for the company!
options:
Create an artificial neural network that would host the company directory.
 Use machine learning to better predict risk.
 Create an algorithm that consolidates all of your Excel spreadsheets into one data lake.
 Use machine learning and big data to research salary requirements.

query: Q19. What is one reason not to use the same data for both your training set and your testing set?
options:
You will almost certainly underfit the model.
 You will pick the wrong algorithm.
 You might not have enough data for both.
 You will almost certainly overfit the model.

query: Q20. Your university wants to use machine learning algorithms to help sort through incoming student applications. An administrator asks if the admissions decisions might be biased against any particular group, such as women. What would be the best answer?
options:
Machine learning algorithms are based on math and statistics, and so by definition will be unbiased.
 There is no way to identify bias in the data.
 Machine learning algorithms are powerful enough to eliminate bias from the data.
 All human-created data is biased, and data scientists need to account for that.

**Explanation**: While machine learning algorithms don't have bias, the data can have them.

query: Q21. What is stacking?
options:
The predictions of one model become the inputs another.
 You use different versions of machine learning algorithms.
 You use several machine learning algorithms to boost your results.
 You stack your training set and testing set together.

query: Q22. You want to create a supervised machine learning system that identifies pictures of kittens on social media. To do this, you have collected more than 100,000 images of kittens. What is this collection of images called?
options:
training data
 linear regression
 big data
 test data

query: Q23. You are working on a project that involves clustering together images of different dogs. You take image and identify it as your centroid image. What type machine learning algorithm are you using?
options:
centroid reinforcement
 K-nearest neighbor
 binary classification
 K-means clustering

**Explanation**: The problem explicitly states "clustering".

query: Q24. Your company wants you to build an internal email text prediction model to speed up the time that employees spend writing emails. What should you do?
options:
Include training email data from all employees.
 Include training email data from new employees.
 Include training email data from seasoned employees.
 Include training email data from employees who write the majority of internal emails.

query: Q25. Your organization allows people to create online professional profiles. A key feature is the ability to create clusters of people who are professionally connected to one another. What type of machine learning method is used to create these clusters?
options:
unsupervised machine learning
 binary classification
 supervised machine learning
 reinforcement learning

query: Q27. Random forest is modified and improved version of which earlier technique?
options:
aggregated trees
 boosted trees
 bagged trees
 stacked trees

query: Q28. Self-organizing maps are specialized neural network for which type of machine learning?
options:
semi-supervised learning
 supervised learning
 reinforcement learning
 unsupervised learning

query: Q29. Which statement about K-means clustering is true?
options:
In K-means clustering, the initial centroids are sometimes randomly selected.
 K-means clustering is often used in supervised machine learning.
 The number of clusters are always randomly selected.
 To be accurate, you want your centroids outside of the cluster.
